snippet: A state appeals court has overturned the pandering conviction of Heidi Fleiss, ruling that jurors engaged in vote-swapping misconduct to avoid a deadlock.         In a 15-page opinion, the Second District Court of Appeal ordered that a new  trial ...
lead_paragraph: A state appeals court has overturned the pandering conviction of Heidi Fleiss, ruling that jurors engaged in vote-swapping misconduct to avoid a deadlock. In a 15-page opinion, the Second District Court of Appeal ordered that a new trial be held, said Emma Amos, a spokeswoman for the court. The opinion was filed Tuesday and released today.

headline.main: Conviction Quashed In Heidi Fleiss Case
